sanskrit_verse:
स्वप्ने सिक्त्वा ब्रह्मचारी द्विजः शुक्रमकामतः ।
स्नात्वाऽर्कमर्चयित्वा त्रिः पुनर्मामित्यृचं जपेत् ॥ २.१८१॥
transliteration:
svapne siktva brahmacārī dvijaḥ śukramakāmataḥ |
snātvā'rkamarcayitvā triḥ punarmāmityṛcaṃ japet ||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a twice-born celibate discharges seminal fluid involuntarily during sleep, he shall bathe, worship the Sun, and thrice recite the mantra 'punarmām'.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: The twice-born individual holds inherent spiritual capacity under Vedic discipline.
Causation: Involuntary emission does not incur moral fault; natural physiological process is acknowledged.
Capacity-based responsibility: Restitution lies in conscious realignment through ritual purification.
Restoration logic: Ritual and repetition restore energetic integrity disrupted by involuntary discharge.
Consciousness alignment: Invocation of solar energy realigns consciousness with disciplined intent.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent.is_brahmachari AND emission_occurred == 'involuntary' THEN execute_purification_protocol = TRUE
supreme_court_application: In adjudication involving spiritual practitioners, involuntary physiological acts carry no culpability. The court recognizes completion of prescribed restitution rituals as legally valid restoration of dharmic standing.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa acknowledges absence of volition. Anupūrvaśaḥ reflects sequential purification. Proportionality aligns with non-harm. Non-punitive reality upholds dharma through self-corrective action.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Solar Invocation Protocol upon breach report
Verify ceremonial bathing completion via witness attestation

Issue Realignment Certificate upon protocol fulfillment
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness is the Supreme Adjudicator.
